Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red pottery vessel, fabric is grey in section, interior slightly ribbed, exterior covered with a cream-coloured slip and remains of one line of black-painted hieratic text identifying contents as [wine from] the western river.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393185) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393185)
